FullwaveQC Documentation¶

fullwaveqc.tools.ampnorm(Obs, Pred, ref_trace=0, verbose=1)¶

Normalises the amplitude of a predicted dataset with an observed dataset by matching the values of their maximum amplitudes of a reference trace.

Parameters

  • Obs – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the observed data

  • Pred – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the predicted data. Requires same number of samples, sampling interval, shots and receiver positions as Obs

  • ref_trace – (int) trace number to each normalise each shot. For streamer data, this value should be 0 in order to normalise it to the first arrival trace. Default 0

  • verbose – (bool) Set to true to verbose the steps of this function. Default 1

Returns

PredNorm (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function with the normalise predicted data

fullwaveqc.tools.bandpass(trace, flow, fhigh, forder, dt)¶

Band passes a trace using a Butter filter.

Parameters

  • trace – (np.array) 1D array containing the signal in time domain

  • flow – (float) low frquency to band pass

  • fhigh – (float) high frequency to band pass

  • forder – (int) order of band pass filter, determines the steepnes of the transition band

  • dt – (float) Time sampling of the signal

Returns

filtered (np.array) 1D array of same size as trace, with the filtered signal

fullwaveqc.tools.ddwi(MonObs, BaseObs, BasePred, normalise=True, name=None, mon_filepath=None, save=False, save_path='./', verbose=1)¶

Creates the monitor dataset used as the observed dataset for the Double Difference Waveform Inversion. The DDWI monitor dataset is given by: u_mon = d_mon - d_base + u_base Where d_mon and d_base are the observed monitor and baseline datasets, respectively, and u_base is the dataset from a predicted baseline inversion model.

Parameters

  • MonObs – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the true monitor data

  • BaseObs – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the true baseline data. Requires same number of samples, sampling interval, shots and receiver positions as MonObs

  • BasePred – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the predicted baseline data. Requires same number of samples, sampling interval, shots and receiver positions as MonObs.

  • normalise – (bool) if true will normalise the amplitude of the predicted baseline dataset to match the first trace of the observed dataset. Does so shot by shot. Default True

  • name – (str) name to give the DDWI dataset, if None will give the name “DDWI-DATASET”. Default None

  • mon_filepath – (str) path to the observed monitor dataset. Must end in .sgy. Required if save option is set to True. Default None.

  • save – (bool) Set to true if the DDWI dataset is to be saved in .sgy format. Default False

  • save_path – (str) Path to folder where DDWI must be saved. Default “./”

  • verbose – (bool) Set to true in order to verbose the steps of this function. Default 1

Returns

MON_DIFF (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function with the DDWI monitor data

fullwaveqc.tools.load(filepath, model, scale=1, verbose=1)¶

Loads a segy file into a SegyData or Model class, used for the other functionalities of the fullwaveqc package. Accepts 2D segy files and of the same sampling interval for all shots and segy model files with square cells

Parameters

  • filepath – (str) path to segy file. Must end in .sgy

  • model – (bool) Set true to load a Model and false to load a SegyData object

  • scale – (float) Value to multiply the data content of the files. Default 1

  • verbose – (bool) Set to true in order to verbose the steps of this loading function. Default True

Return:

fullwaveqc.tools.SegyData or fullwave,tools.Model object

fullwaveqc.tools.rm_empty_traces(filename, scale=1, verbose=1)¶

Removes all-zero traces of a segy file and saves the copy of the clean file in the same directory

Parameters

  • filename – (str) path to segy file, must end in .sgy

  • scale – (float) Value to multiply the data content of the files. Default 1

  • verbose – (bool) Set to true in order to verbose the steps of this loading function. Default True

Return:

None

fullwaveqc.tools.smooth_model(Model, strength=[1, 1], name=None, save=False, save_path='./')¶

Smoothes a model using scipy’s gaussian filter in “reflect” mode.

Parameters

  • Model – (Model) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for a model

  • strength – (list of floats) [horizontal_smoothing_factor, vertical_smoothing_factor]. Default [1,1]

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the model in .sgy format. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the .sgy smoothed model. Default “./”

  • name – (str) name of the new smoothed model. If None it will be inferred from Model. Default None

Returns

SmoothModel: (Model) object as outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function containing the smoothed model

fullwaveqc.geom.boundarycalc(d, dx, fmin, vmax)¶

Calculates the number of absorbing boundaries and number of cells from the source recommended for a Fullwave run without reflections and interferences. Number of absorbing boundaries computed as to guarantee it covers two of the largest wavelengths. Distance from source computed to guarantee one Fresnel zone between the source and the first receiver. The total number of padding cells above the source should therefore be nabsorb + ndist.

Parameters

  • d – (float) distance between source and first receiver in units of distance (meters)

  • dx – (float) size of model cell in units of distance (meters)

  • fmin – (float) minimum frequency present in the wavelet (Hz)

  • vmax – (float) maximum P-wave velocity expected from the models (m/s)

Returns

nabsorb (int) number of absorbing boundary cells recommended for the specific problem

Returns

ndist (int) number of padded cells from the source to the start of the absorbing boundaries

fullwaveqc.geom.surveygeom(rcvgeopath, srcgeopath, src_list=[], plot=False, verbose=0)¶

Retrieves and plots the in-line positions of the survey array as understood from SegyPrep.

Parameters

  • rcvgeopath – (str) path to file <PROJECT_NAME>-Receivers.geo generated by SegyPrep

  • srcgeopath – (str) path to file <PROJECT_NAME>-Sources.geo generated by SegyPrep

  • src_list – (list) list of source/shot numbers to retrieve and plot. Empty list returns all positions. Default: []

  • plot – (bool) If true will plot the shots and receivers of src_list. Default:False

  • verbose – (bool) If true will print to console the steps of this function. Default: False

Returns

src_ret (list) list of all in-line positions from the sources in src_list

Returns

rcv_ret (list) list of numpy.arrays, for each source in src_list, with its array of in-line receiver positions

fullwaveqc.visual.amplitude(SegyData, shot=1, cap=0.0, levels=100, vmin=None, vmax=None, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, xstart=0, xend=None, wstart=0, wend=None, save=False, save_path='./')¶

Plots the amplitude map of a SegyData object in timesamples vs receiver index. Uses properties of matplotlib.contourf.

Parameters

  • SegyData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data

  • shot – (int) shot number to visualise. Count starts from 1. Default 1

  • cap – (float) absolute value of amplitudes to cap, shown as 0. Default 0.

  • levels – (int) amount of levels in the contour plot. Default 100

  • vmin – (float) min val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • vmax – (float) max val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • cmap – (plt.cm) cmap object. Default plt.cm.seismic

  • xstart – (int) first receiver index to plot. Default 0.

  • xend – (int) last receiver index to plot. Default None

  • wstart – (int) first timesample in time units to plot. Default 0

  • wend – (int) last timesample in time units to plot. Default None

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the plot in png 300dpi. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the plot. Default “./”

Returns

None

fullwaveqc.visual.animateinv(it_max, path, project_name, vmin=None, vmax=None, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, save=False, save_path='./', verbose=0)¶

Animates the evolution of an inversion progression outputted by Fullwave3D. Files searched for must be named: <project_name>-CPxxxxx-Vp.sgy and be all located in the same path folder.

Parameters

  • it_max – (int) max amount of iterations to be analysed

  • path – (str) path to folder where .sgy model files are located

  • project_name – (str) name of the project – must match exactly

  • vmin – (float) min val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • vmax – (float) max val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • cmap – (plt.cm) cmap object. Default plt.cm.jet

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the animation

  • save_path – (str) path to save the animation. Default “./”

  • verbose – (bool) set to true to verbose the steps of this function

Returns

None

fullwaveqc.visual.interamp(SegyData1, SegyData2, shot=1, shot2=None, n_blocks=2, cap=0.0, levels=100, vmin=None, vmax=None, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, wstart=0, wend=None, save=False, save_path='./')¶

Plots the interleaving amplitude map of a SegyData1 and SegyData2 objects in timesamples vs receiver index. Uses properties of matplotlib.contourf.

Parameters

  • SegyData1 – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data

  • SegyData2 – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data Requires same number of samples, sampling interval, shots and receiver positions as SegyData1

  • shot – (int) shot number to visualise SegyData1. Default 1

  • shot2 – (int) shot number to visualise SegyData2. Count starts from 1. If None, will . be read the same as ‘shot’. Default None

  • n_blocks – (int) Number of total blocks in the interleaving space

  • cap – (float) absolute value of amplitudes to cap, shown as 0. Default 0.

  • levels – (int) amount of levels in the contour plot. Default 100

  • vmin – (float) min val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • vmax – (float) max val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • cmap – (plt.cm) cmap object. Default plt.cm.seismic

  • wstart – (int) first timesample in time units to plot. Default 0

  • wend – (int) last timesample in time units to plot. Default None

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the plot in png 300dpi. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the plot. Default “./”

Returns

None

Returns

fullwaveqc.visual.interwiggle(SegyData1, SegyData2, shot=1, shot2=None, overlay=False, scale=5, skip_trace=20, skip_time=0, delay_samples=0, wstart=0, wend=None, xstart=0, xend=None, label1='SegyData1', label2='SegyData2', save=False, save_path='./')¶

Plots the interleaving wiggle trace map of a SegyData1 and SegyData2 objects in timesamples vs receiver index.

Parameters

  • SegyData1 – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data

  • SegyData2 – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data

  • shot – (int) shot number to visualise SegyData1. Default 1

  • shot2 – (int) shot number to visualise SegyData2. Count starts from 1. If None, will be read the same as ‘shot’. Default None

  • overlay – (bool) If true, traces will be overlaid in different colours instead of being displayed side by side. Default False

  • scale – (float) value to scale the amplitude of the wiggles for visualisation only. Default 1

  • skip_trace – (int) Number of traces to skip. Default 0.

  • skip_time – (int) Number of time samples to skip. Default 0

  • xstart – (int) first receiver index to plot. Default 0.

  • xend – (int) last receiver index to plot. Default None

  • wstart – (int) first timesample in time units to plot. Default 0

  • wend – (int) last timesample in time units to plot. Default None

  • delay_samples – (int) number of time samples to delay the signal. Will pad the signal with 0s at the beginning. Default 0

  • label1 – (str) Label for SegyData1. Default SegyData1

  • label2 – (str) Label for SegyData2. Default SegyData2

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the plot in png 300dpi. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the plot. Default “./”

Returns

None

fullwaveqc.visual.vpmodel(Model, cap=0.0, levels=200, vmin=None, vmax=None, cmap=<matplotlib.colors.LinearSegmentedColormap object>, units='m/s', save=False, save_path='./')¶

Plots the P-velocity amplitude map of a Model object in depth and lateral offset. Uses properties of matplotlib.contourf.

Parameters

  • Model – (Model) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for a model

  • cap – (float) absolute value of P-wave values to cap, below this all are shown as 0. Default 0.

  • levels – (int) amount of levels in the contour plot. Default 200

  • vmin – (float) min val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • vmax – (float) max val of color plot scale. Default None.

  • cmap – (plt.cm) cmap object. Default plt.cm.jet

  • units – (str) units of amplitudes to show in colorbar. Default m/s

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the plot in png 300dpi. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the plot. Default “./”

Returns

None

fullwaveqc.visual.vpwell(Model, pos_x, TrueModel=None, plot=True)¶

Retrieves the Vp well profile from a Model at specified locations

Parameters

  • Model – (Model) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for a model

  • pos_x – (list of ints) lateral distances to which retrieve the well data

  • TrueModel – (Model) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the true model. Default None

  • plot – (bool) Plots the profiles when set to true.

Returns

wells, true_wells, rmses (np.arrays) with well values and root mean square errors as compared to a true model, or simply returns well if no TrueModel is given.

fullwaveqc.visual.wiggle(SegyData, shot=1, scale=5, skip_trace=0, skip_time=0, wstart=0.0, wend=None, xstart=0, xend=None, delay_samples=0, save=False, save_path='./')¶

Plots the wiggle trace map of a SegyData object in timesamples vs receiver index.

Parameters

  • SegyData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function for the segy data

  • shot – (int) shot number to visualise. Count starts from 1. Default 1

  • scale – (float) value to scale the amplitude of the wiggles for visualisation only. Default 1

  • skip_trace – (int) Number of traces to skip. Default 0.

  • skip_time – (int) Number of time samples to skip. Default 0

  • xstart – (int) first receiver index to plot. Default 0.

  • xend – (int) last receiver index to plot. Default None

  • wstart – (int) first timesample in time units to plot. Default 0

  • wend – (int) last timesample in time units to plot. Default None

  • delay_samples – (int) number of time samples to delay the signal. Will pad the signal with 0s at the beginning. Default 0

  • save – (bool) set to true in order to save the plot in png 300dpi. Default False

  • save_path – (str) path to save the plot. Default “./”

Returns

None

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.closest2pow(n)¶

Finds the first integer greater or equal to n that is a power of 2

:param n (float) any positive number :return: n2pow (int) the first integer greater or equal to n that is an exact power of two :raises ValueError if n is less or equal to zero

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.dataspec(SegyData, ms=True, shot=1, fmax=None, fft_smooth=1, plot=False)¶

Returns and plots the frequency spectrum of a single shot of a dataset. Does so by stacking the frequencies of each individual trace.

Parameters

  • SegyData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • ms – (bool) Set to true if sampling rate in Wavelet object is in milliseconds, otherwise assumed in seconds. Default: True

:param shot (int) Shot number to compute the frequency spectrum. Default 1 :param fmax: (float) Value of the highest frequency expected in the signal. Default: None :param plot: (bool) Will plot the spectrum and phases of the dataset in the frequency if set to True

Default: False

Parameters

fft_smooth – (int) Parameter used to multiply the number of samples inputted into the Fast Fourier Transform. Increase this factor for a smoother plot. The final number of sample points will be the nearest power of two of fft_smooth multiplied by the original number of time samples in the signal. Higher value increases computational time. Default: 1

Returns

xf (np.array) 1D array containing the frequencies

Returns

yf (np.array) 1D array containing the power of the frequencies in dB

Returns

phase (np.array) 1D array containing the unwrapped phases at each frequency

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.gausswindow(samples, wstart, wend, dt)¶

Create a gaussian function to window a signal

Parameters

  • samples – (int) Total of points in the function

  • wstart – (int) Start time of the window (ms)

  • wend – (int) End time of the window (ms)

  • dt – (float) Time sampling of the signal(ms)

Returns

w (numpy.array) 1D array of a gaussian window of size (samples, 1)

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.phasediff(PredData, ObsData, f=1, wstart=200, wend=1000, nr_max=None, ns_max=None, ms=True, fft_smooth=1, plot=False, verbose=1)¶

Computes and plots the phase difference between an observed and predicted dataset, at a single specified frequency, for all receivers and shots

Parameters

  • PredData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • ObsData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • f – (float) Frequency in Hz at which the phase difference should be calculated Default: 1

  • wstart – (int) Time sample to which start the window for the phase difference computation Default: 200

  • wend – (int) Time sample to which end the window for the phase difference computation Default: 1000

  • nr_max – (int) Maximum number of receivers to which calculate the phase difference. If None is given, then number of receivers is inferred from the datasets. Default: None

  • ns_max – (int) Maximum number of sources/shots to which calculate the phase difference. If None is given then number of sources is inferred from the datasets Default: None

  • ms – (bool) Set to true if sampling rate in Wavelet object is in miliseconds, otherwise assumed in seconds. Default: True

  • fft_smooth – (int) Parameter used to multiply the number of samples inputted into the Fast Fourier Transform. Increase this factor for a smoother plot. The final number of sample points will be the nearest power of two of fft_smooth multiplied by the original number of time samples in the signal. Higher value increases computational time. Default: 1

  • plot – (bool) Will plot the phase difference if set to True Default: False

  • verbose – (bool) If set to True will verbose the main steps of the function calculation. Default 1

Returns

phase_pred (np.array) phase_pred 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phases of the

predicted dataset at the specified frequency

phase_obs (np.array) phase_obs 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phases of the

observed dataset at the specified frequency

phase_diff (np.array) phase_diff 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phase differences

between the observed and predicted datasets at the specified frequency

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.wavespec(Wavelet, ms=True, fmax=None, plot=False, fft_smooth=1)¶

Returns and plots the frequency spectrum of a source wavelet.

Parameters

  • Wavelet – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • ms – (bool) Set to true if sampling rate in Wavelet object is in miliseconds, otherwise assumed in seconds. Default: True

  • fmax – (float) Value of the highest frequency expected in the signal Default: None

  • plot – (bool) Will plot the wavelet in time and wave frequencies if set to True Default: False

  • fft_smooth – (int) Parameter used to multiply the number of samples inputted into the Fast Fourier Transform. Increase this factor for a smoother plot. The final number of sample points will be the nearest power of two of fft_smooth multiplied by the original number of time samples in the signal. Higher value increases computational time. Default: 1

Returns

xf (np.array) 1D array containing the frequencies

Returns

yf (np.array) 1D array containing the power of the frequencies in dB

Returns

phase (np.array) 1D array containing the unwrapped phases at each frequency

fullwaveqc.siganalysis.xcorr(PredData, ObsData, wstart=0, wend=-1, nr_max=None, ns_max=None, ms=True, plot=False, verbose=1)¶

Computes and plots the cross-correlation between an observed and predicted dataset using numpy.correlate. Traces are normalised to unit length for comparison

Parameters

  • PredData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • ObsData – (SegyData) object outputted from fullwaveqc.tools.load function

  • wstart – (int) Time sample to which start the window for the phase difference computation Default: 200

  • wend – (int) Time sample to which end the window for the phase difference computation Default: 1000

  • nr_max – (int) Maximum number of receivers to which calculate the phase difference. If None is given then max number of receivers is inferred from the PredData and ObsData Default: None

  • ns_max – (int) Maximum number of sources/shots to which calculate the phase difference. If None is given, then max number of sources is inferred from the datasets Default: None

  • ms – (bool) Set to true if sampling rate in Wavelet object is in miliseconds, otherwise assumed in seconds. Default: True

  • plot – (bool) Will plot the phase difference if set to True Default: False

  • verbose – (bool) If set to True will verbose the main steps of the function calculation. Default 1

Returns

xcorr_arr (np.array) 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phases of the

predicted dataset at the specified frequency

(np.array) phase_obs 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phases of the

observed dataset at the specified frequency

(np.array) phase_diff 2D array of size (ns_max, nr_max) with the unwrapped phase differences

between the observed and predicted datasets at the specified frequency

fullwaveqc.inversion.functional(filepath, name=None, plot=False)¶

Retrieves and plots the global functional value of an inversion run with Fullwave3D as recorded in the job log file

Parameters

  • filepath – (str) path to <PROJECT_NAME>_job,log file

  • name – (str) name of the project. If not given, will be inferred from filename. Default: None

  • plot – (bool) if true will produce a plot of the functional values vs iterations. Default: False

Returns

iter_all (np.array) array of iteration numbers of the run of size (number_of_iterations, 1)

Returns

func (np.array) array of functional of size (number_of_iterations, 1)

fullwaveqc.inversion.steplen(filepath, name=None, plot=False)¶

Retrieves and plots the step length value of an inversion run with Fullwave3D as recorded in the job log file

Parameters

  • filepath – (str) path to <PROJECT_NAME>_job,log file

  • name – (str) name of the project. If not given, will be inferred from filename. Default: None

  • plot – (bool) if true will produce a plot of the step length values vs iterations. Default: False

Returns

iter_all (np.array) array of iteration numbers of the run of size (number_of_iterations, 1)

Returns

steplenarr (np.array) array of step length values of size (number_of_iterations, 1)
